name: Sunethal (Alpha)
description:
Sunethal is a physics-driven combined with a cool energy system puzzle game. The player will have to complete several challenges to reach the exit door. In this demo, there are not many levels, but there will be much more!. Please keep in mind that the current game is heavily a WIP, and most of what you will see in-game might or will change in the future.

Sunethal background is settled in a utopian world where everything is based on a dream. The player does not know that he is living a dream, but as he plays the game and solves the mystery, he begins to understand its history. 

There will be one or more special puzzles in each level that tell the history and let the player understand the game's history. Whenever the player solves each special puzzle, he will be rewarded with a history puzzle piece. 

The game's idea is that there will be a final puzzle where the player has to introduce all the pieces found in each special puzzle to solve it and reveal the history.

How to Play?
  • Download the game from the given link.
  • Once it has finished downloading, extract the folder named "Sunethal" into a location of your choice.
  • If you did everything correctly, you will see a Sunethal.exe inside that folder.
  • To play, simply execute the .exe and the game should run.
Features
  • Several puzzle mechanics such as the Node System, with several types of logic gates and cables.
  • Physics objects that can be freezed and grabbed.
  • Good performance on most computers.
  • Minimalist and simple graphic design.
  • Clean UI for easy understanding of what each thing does.
  • Simple saving system based on last level played, player location and other saving is planed for the future.
  • Discord rich presence!
Game Performance

My gaming computer has an i7 3770k @3.7ghz, 16gb of DDR3 ram and a RTX 2060. Having the game at max settings with shadows med and post processing at low and 1440p, the maximum FPS are around 140.

Key Bindings
  • Movement: WASD
  • Look around: Mouse
  • Interact: E
  • Grab: Left mouse click
  • Freeze: Right mouse click
  • Jump: Space bar
  • Sprint: Left Shift
  • Crouch: Left Control
  • Pause: Escape
